member.summary: This class implements an to provide support for deserialization of the type using JSON.NET.
member.remarks: The contract created for will deserialize properties using the types and property names of the underlying type. member.name: T:System.Web.Http.TableDependencyScopeExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for facilitating getting the services used by the backend.

members.member:
Determines the set of properties to include in the OData $select query option for types implementing the interface. has two sets of properties: regular properties and system properties. The system properties are only included if the __systemproperties query parameter is included in the Request URI. This function determines the combined set of selected properties and updates the request URI accordingly, if necessary.
The request to manipulate. The type of the data model. Indicates whether the original Request URI $select clause has been manipulated or not. The query is not actually validated in this step -- this happens as part of the validation. In the case of a type implementing, the set of properties selected; otherwise null.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.TableHttpRequestMessageExtensions.GetQueryOption(System.String[],System.String,System.String[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Detects whether the is present in an OData query and if so returns the index and the value of the option.
member.param: The query to check.
The option to check for.
The index into the query if the option is present; -1 otherwise.
The mapped properties for this model (CLR type).
member.returns: The query option value if present; null otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.TableQueryFilter
member.summary:
Filter for table controllers tailoring a query as follows: 1) Merges the $select query options with any system property selection options. 2) Adds support for $inlinecount by wrapping the response in a .
For returning actions marked with , this filter will "rewrite" the request URL, merging any $select with the system property selection. This ensures that the selection is performed in the DB in cases where the is backed by a DB. This minimizes the DB response size.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.ITableData
member.summary: The provides an abstraction indicating how the system properties for a given table data model are to be serialized when communicating with the clients. The uniform serialization of system properties ensures that the clients can process the system properties uniformly across platforms.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.TableColumnAttribute
member.summary: The can be used to annotate data model properties that represent system properties used by the . By indicating which columns are the id, version, createdAt, etc. columns, the various domain managers can leverage that information to provide the best possible mapping to any particular backend store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.TableColumnAttribute.TableColumnAnnotation
member.summary: When registering the with Entity Framework using a model builder code first convention, use this name as the table column annotation name. See https://entityframework.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Code%20First%20Annotations for more information about Entity Framework code first conventions and code annotations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.IDomainManager`1
member.summary: Provides an abstraction for accessing a backend store for a . The abstraction can be implemented in one of two ways depending on the capabilities of the backend store. Stores that support a -based model can implement the and methods whereas stores that don't support directly or where it is not the preferred way of accessing them can implement the and methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.IDomainManager`1.Query
member.summary: Builds an to be executed against a store supporting for querying data.
member.remarks: See also which is the companion method for creating an representing a single item.
member.returns: An which has not yet been executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.IDomainManager`1.Lookup(System.String)
member.summary: Builds an to be executed against a store supporting for looking up a single item.
member.param: The id representing the item. The id is provided as part of the and is visible to the client. However, depending on the backend store and the domain model, the particular implementation may map the id to some other form of unique identifier.
member.remarks: See also which is the companion method for creating an representing multiple items.
member.returns: A containing the which has not yet been executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.IDomainManager`1.QueryAsync(System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Executes the provided against a store.
member.remarks: See also which is the companion method for executing a lookup for a single item.
member.param: The query to execute.
member.returns: An representing the result of the query.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.IDomainManager`1.LookupAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a single item in the backend store.
member.param: The id representing the item. The id is provided as part of the and is visible to the client. However, depending on the backend store and the domain model, the particular implementation may map the id to some other form of unique identifier.
member.remarks: See also which is the companion method for executing a query for multiple items.
member.returns: A representing the result of the lookup. A represents an containing zero or one entities. This allows it to be composed with further querying such as $select.
